overview: Arnaud is Co-Founder and CEO of Bistri, a company pioneering the use of Open Real Time Communication between browsers. He brings over 10 years of entrepreneurial leadership experience in the Telco business to Bistri, fascinated by VoIP since 1996, during his internship at Vocaltec Internet Phone as evangelist. In June 2012, Bistri provided the first service on the web that allows p2p video calls, on a production platform. Bistri has officially become a W3C Member in October 2012 to support open Web standards and contribute to the WebRTC Working Group. Previously, Arnaud served formerly as Chief Information Officer of BT in France. Arnaud has a MS degree in Computer Science and Networks from ESME-Sudria. Windsurfing since he is 7, he also enjoy skiing in the Alps and diving in Egypt.
